com.google.gwt.gears.client.localserver
Class ResourceStore

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      com.google.gwt.gears.client.localserver.ResourceStore

public final class ResourceStore
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject

Manages an ad-hoc collection of captured URLs, which can be served locally.

Constructor Summary

Constructor Detail

ResourceStore

protected ResourceStore()
Method Detail

abortCapture

public void abortCapture(int captureId)
Aborts the specified capture.

Parameters:
captureId - id of the capture to abort

capture

public int capture(ResourceStoreUrlCaptureHandler callback,
                   java.lang.String... urls)
Initiates an update that runs asynchronously in the background, and returns immediately. The return value is a captureId which can be passed to abortCapture to cancel the update. Relative URLs are interpreted according to the current page's location. Upon completion of each URL the handler instance is notified. An additional HTTP header is added when Gears is capturing URLs X-Gears-Google: 1

Parameters:
callback - invoked per capture
urls - set of URLs to capture
Returns:
capture id for capture request
Throws:
com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptException - if any of the URLs are not from the same origin as the current page

captureFile

public void captureFile(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element fileInputElement,
                        java.lang.String url)
Captures the contents of the file indicated by the fileInputElement into the store and associates that content with the given URL. The fileInputElement argument must be a reference to an <input type=file> HTML element.

Parameters:
fileInputElement - element containing the file to capture
url - URL to associate with the file capture
Throws:
com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptException - if the URL is not from the same origin as the current page or if the file cannot be read

copy

public void copy(java.lang.String srcUrl,
                 java.lang.String destUrl)
Copies a cached URL.

Parameters:
srcUrl - source URL
destUrl - destination URL
Throws:
com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptException - if the source or destination URLs are not from the same origin as the current page

createFileSubmitter

public FileSubmitter createFileSubmitter()
Returns a FileSubmitter, which is used to submit URLs that are contained in this store in HTML form submissions.

Returns:
FileSubmitter instance

getAllHeaders

public java.lang.String getAllHeaders(java.lang.String url)
Returns all HTTP headers associated with the captured URL.

Parameters:
url - captured URL
Returns:
all HTTP headers associated with the URL
Throws:
com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptException - if the URL is not from the same origin as the current page

getCapturedFileName

public java.lang.String getCapturedFileName(java.lang.String url)
Returns the leaf file name associated with url that was previously captured by calling captureFile. Note that if url was captured by a method other than calling captureFile then an empty string will be returned and no exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
url - URL whose file name we want
Returns:
leaf file name associated with the URL or an empty if there is none
Throws:
com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptException - if the URL is not from the same origin as the current page

getHeader

public java.lang.String getHeader(java.lang.String url,
                                  java.lang.String name)
Returns a specific HTTP header associated with the captured URL.

Parameters:
url - captured URL
name - HTTP header name
Returns:
HTTP header value
Throws:
com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptException - if the URL is not from the same origin as the current page

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of this store.

Returns:
name of the this store

getRequiredCookie

public java.lang.String getRequiredCookie()
Returns the cookie requirements of the store. For further details see Cookies and the LocalServer. If the requiredCookie is empty, then resources within this store are always served locally, provided the store is enabled.

Returns:
required cookie for this store

isCaptured

public boolean isCaptured(java.lang.String url)
Returns true if the URL is cached in this store.

Parameters:
url - URL to test
Returns:
true if the URL is cached in this store
Throws:
com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptException - if the URL is not from the same origin as the current page

isEnabled

public boolean isEnabled()
Returns true if local serving is enabled for this store, false otherwise.

Returns:
true if local serving is enabled for this store, false otherwise

remove

public void remove(java.lang.String url)
Removes the cached URL from this store.

Parameters:
url - URL to remove
Throws:
com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptException - if the URL is not from the same origin as the current page

rename

public void rename(java.lang.String srcUrl,
                   java.lang.String destUrl)
Renames a URL that is cached in this store.

Parameters:
srcUrl - source URL
destUrl - destination URL
Throws:
com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptException - if the source or destination URLs are not from the same origin as the current page

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
Sets the local serving state of this store.

Parameters:
enabled - true to enable local serving, false otherwise
